true the green skull does mean what you say man but take it from someone who has PERSONAL experience from these "false positives" in the past I have downloaded games with cracks and they always came up with virus's (trojans) and that exact trojan....and I use a more advanced better virus scanner and firewall then windows defender and when I said what he did on the site I got it from they said same thing "its a false positive ignore it because its a crack so essentually its a hack so yea just ignore it".....EVERY game I ever did that for ALWAYS F**** up my computer and I always BARELY got it recovered it replaces the win32 file that is one of the many files to make the OS run and yea.....so I no longer trust any game that I download that has a "virus" in it.....regardless of the possiblility that it might be false or not so I will say this....I am not saying this trojan alert is a real trojan or not but what I will say is this only download at you're own risk (just incase iis real I though I would make that point) but even if this is an actual false positive I hope everyone that reads this takes my lesson into account to not trust every "false positive" because they jsut might not be false

Try running the game in admin mode, and with win xp compatibility. You can also try running in 256 colors. These are fixes to older games, but they might not work since this is an old game that has been remade for new PCs.

@hazarddose

It just seems their "tweaks" didn't make it run perfectly on new machines. Try making a couple of your own tweaks(this worked for me). Go to properties of the game .exe and run as admin, set to 256 colors, disable visual themes and desktop compostition, and if that doesnt work also set it to run in win xp(service2) mode.
